content:
I don't have access to current data, so i cannot comment on whether the government of oryol is taking any specific steps. however, i can provide some insights on how governments generally address the impacts of currency depreciation.

most governments would try to reduce the impacts of currency depreciation by implementing policies that focus on stabilizing the domestic economy. this could involve measures to control inflation, promote domestic production, encourage exports and reduce imports, and stabilize the exchange rate. for instance, the government may try to promote local production by providing subsidies and tax incentives to domestic industries, or it may introduce policies to stabilize the exchange rate such as selling foreign reserves or adjusting interest rates.

overall, the effectiveness of these measures will depend on several factors such as the level of exchange rate volatility, the severity of inflation, the structure of the economy, and the political environment.
